metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14212 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
FFmpeg through 4.3 has a heap-based buffer overflow in avio_get_str inlibavformat/aviobuf.c because dnn_backend_native.c callsff_dnn_load_model_native and a certain index check is omitted.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14212` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.3.1-1ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.3.1-1ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra59 - 7:4.3.1-1ubuntu1
libavcodec59 - 7:4.3.1-1ubuntu1
libavdevice59 - 7:4.3.1-1ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.3.1-1ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra8 - 7:4.3.1-1ubuntu1
libavfilter8 - 7:4.3.1-1ubuntu1
libavformat-extra - 7:4.3.1-1ubuntu1
libavformat-extra59 - 7:4.3.1-1ubuntu1
libavformat59 - 7:4.3.1-1ubuntu1
libavutil57 - 7:4.3.1-1ubuntu1
libpostproc56 - 7:4.3.1-1ubuntu1
libswresample4 - 7:4.3.1-1ubuntu1
libswscale6 - 7:4.3.1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:4.3.1-1ubuntu1').
qtwebengine-opensource-src package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
vice package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
